titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Allen Sapp Score Collection, circa 1936-1992
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Bewley.

publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library
publicationstmt.p: © 2010. State University of New York at Buffalo. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by John Bewley, March 2010.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard ).

did.head: Collection Overview

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The Allen Sapp Score Collection contains manuscript and holograph scores of works composed by Allen Sapp. The collection also contains some of Sapp's drafts, outlines, and twelve-tone row forms and matrices; as well as exercises, analysis, and arrangements of other composer's works completed while at Harvard University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Allen Sapp Score Collection, circa 1936-1992, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection is held by Allen Sapp's sons, Christopher S. Dawson and Anthony C. Sapp. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was given to the Music Library by Allen Sapp's sons, Christopher S. Dawson and Anthony C. Sapp.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Allen Sapp was born in Philadelphia on December 10, 1922. He began piano lessons at an early age, developed an interest in music composition, and began performing his own work at the age of ten. After graduating from the Haverford School in 1939, he entered Harvard University, where he studied with Walter Piston, Archibald T. Davison, and Irving Fine. Many of Sapp's works were performed while he was an undergraduate, including the Andante for Orchestra, which won second prize in the New York Philharmonic Young Composer's Contest, and was performed by that group in April 1942.

Also in 1942, Sapp graduated from Harvard and was awarded the John Knowles Paine Fellowship, which allowed him to attend Tanglewood and to begin private composition lessons with Aaron Copland and Nadia Boulanger. After serving as a cryptanalyst in the U.S. Army during W.W.II, Sapp returned to Harvard and earned a Master's degree in 1949. He then joined the faculty at Harvard, teaching there until 1958, and at Wellesley College from 1958-61.

From 1961 to 1975 Sapp was chair of the Music Department of the University at Buffalo, The State University of New York. During this time, he helped establish the university as a leading center for experimental and new music, co-founding the Center of the Creative and Performing Arts with Lukas Foss in 1964. Sapp also assumed leadership positions in several national arts organizations, including Arts/Worth and the American Council for the Arts in Education, of which he was elected executive director in 1972.

Sapp later served as Provost for Communications and the Arts at Florida State University from 1976-78; and as Dean, then Professor of Composition, at the University of Cincinnati College-Conservatory of Music from 1978-93. In 1986 he was awarded the George Rieveschl Award for Distinguished Creative and Scholarly Works at the University of Cincinnati, and in 1993 was commissioned by the Cincinnati Chamber Orchestra to write a commemorative work for the group's twentieth anniversary. His works have also been performed by the Philharmonia Orchestra of the University of Cincinnati College-Conservatory of Music, the Cincinnati Wind Ensemble, the Buffalo Philharmonic, the Ohio University Chamber Orchestra, l'Orchestre de la Radiodiffusion Française, and the Boston Fine Arts Chamber orchestra.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Allen Sapp Score Collection, ca. 1936-1992, contains 343 folders of paper, vellum, or Multilith manuscript scores; bound and unbound performance parts; ozalid or photocopied reproductions of scores and parts; manuscript notebooks; and outlines on graph, staff, or lined writing paper. Overall, approximately 180 complete works are represented.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in seven series:

list.item: I. Manuscripts of Works Assigned a "W" Number in Allen Sapp: A Bio-Bibliography, by Alan Green (Greenwood Press, 1996)
II. Manuscripts of Titled Works Not Assigned a "W" Number
III. Manuscripts of Works Without Titles or Numbers
V. Row Forms, Matrices, and Outlines
VII. Arrangements, Transcriptions, and Analyses of Other Composer's Works

did.unittitle: Manuscripts of Works Assigned a "W" Number in Allen Sapp: A Bio-Bibliography, by Alan Green (Greenwood Press, 1996), 1939-1994

scopecontent.p: Titles are stated as they appear in the above bibliography, organized by the work numbers assigned in that book. Alternative titles taken directly from the manuscripts, when present, are listed as a second, un-italicized title. Dates are taken directly from manuscripts. In cases where conflicting dates are indicated, both are included, along with their location on the manuscript. Unless otherwise noted, manuscripts are paper.

arrangement.p: Arranged in ascending order by "W" number.

Staff paper, 9 leaves; vellum, 1 p., undated

note.p: Labeled "Raw Patterns 1955-"; row forms for W16, W18, W19, W20, W60, W62, W105, W113, W115, W127

did.unittitle: Manilla folder and 1 page of lined notebook paper, undated

note.p: Folder labeled "Compositions 1975-76:; paper contains listing of pieces and names, i.e. "for Bayerly" and "the Boldts" associated with them.

did.unittitle: Graph paper stapled to manilla folders, 2 p., undated

odd.p: For piano, horns, marimba, glockenspiel, bells, xylophone, vibraphone, percussion, double basses, tubas, trumpets

note.p: "Black Holes and White Dwarfs"; 12-tone matrix, Greek letters, no staff notation

did.unittitle: Lined paper, 1 p. ; staff paper, 1 p., undated

scopecontent.p: Dates, when given, are taken from manuscripts or are approximations based on appearance of item, presence of annotations, or accompanying material.

did.unittitle: Five 7 X 10 Clarke's Music Tablet manuscript books, late 1930's, early 1940’s

note.p: 2 tablets labeled on cover: Allen Sapp, Cheswold Lane, Haverford, PA. 1 tablet labeled Allen Sapp, 28 Gannock Terrace, Lansdowne, PA. 1 tablet with no address information, and 1 tablet with pages torn from binding. Exercises and sketches, chord progressions. Some text notes on harmonic practice, chord resolutions, etc. Corrections in red pencil.

did.unittitle: Two 9 X 12 spiral bound manuscript books, late 1930's, early 1940's

note.p: Choral and vocal settings. 1 manuscript book labeled on cover: Allen Sapp Jr., Music H. Corrections and comments in red ink and pencil throughout. Contents: A) "No. 94," 1st line of text: "Marching proudly, marching proudly, went our soldiers to fight in battle… " SATB, a cappella, 1 p. B) "No. 94": "Starry banner proudly flying over the city…" SATB, a cappella, 1 p. C) "No. 67": "Have you ever heard an echo clear, listen as we sing and you shall hear… " SATB, a cappella, 1 p D). "67": "In the woods the echos hide, shout and they shout back from every side… " SATB, a cappella, 1 p. E) "110": "Give three long cheers for sailors on the sea… " SATB, a cappella, 3 p. F) "133, Valentines": "In the dark of the winter when cold winds do blow, Saint Valentine's day comes like flowers in the snow… " SATB, a cappella, 2 p. G) "Lady Bird: Sweet little lady bird rest a while… " SATB, a cappella, 6 p. H) "The Country Farmer's Boy": "I would not be a monarch great with a crown upon my head… " SATB, a cappella, 6 p. I) "Cock-a-Doodle-Doo, No. 56": "Cock-a doodle doo, my dame has lost her shoe… " SSA, piano, 5 p. Folder also contains a 2nd version, ink manuscript, 1 p. Other manuscript book labeled on cover: Allen Sapp, 231 Mass. Ave., Arlington. Corrections and comments in blue and black pencil throughout. Contents: A) "CS #100": "Ah, here is the open trolley, come for a ride with me…" SATB, a cappella, 2 p. B) Untitled: "My tongue shall sing, shall sing of they righteousness… " SATB, a cappella, 3 p. C) "#76": "One morning early fragrant was the air… " SATB, a cappella, 3 p. D) "65": "On winter night when starry winds are driving forth the snow… " SATB, a cappella, 5 leaves E) Untitled: "Sing a song, a gay and tuneful song of ships… " SATB, a cappella, 2 leaves F) Untitled: "Quam olim Abraham promi sisti matura…" SATB, a cappella, 3 leaves G) Untitled: "Aye wakin' O! Wakin' aye an eerie, sleep I canna get for thinking on my dearie… " vocal solo, piano, 3 leaves H) "At Early Dawn of Morning": "At early dawn of morning, while yet the sky was grey…" STB, piano, 5 leaves
Reduced score, indications for brass, strings, timpani, 14 p; Sketches, 3 p.

did.unittitle: Pencil holograph, annotated, 12 p., late 1930’s, early 1940’s

note.p: Series of exercises with instructions taken from other source, indicated by page numbers in captions. Corrections, red pencil
Caption "Music F- Midyear" Marked in pencil, bottom: "My Grade B-"

did.unittitle: Ink and pencil holograph, annotated, 9 p., late 1930’s, early 1940’s

odd.p: Unspecified; treble, tenor, alto, bass clefs

note.p: Set of 4 fugues, corrections and comments in red pencil
Series of numbered exercises. Harmonic analysis included. Corrections, red pencil
Fugue studies, numbered 2 – 8. Four sharps, 3/2 meter

did.unittitle: Pencil holograph, 12 p., April 23, 1938; March 19 (no year listed)

odd.p: Grand staff, some violin and trumpet with keyboard

note.p: Numbered exercises, no corrections or comments
Series of numbered exercises, 8 measures each

"23" in caption. Two 8-measure exercises, with text notes about choral writing. Chorus text: "Come dance in the orchard ‘mid daisies, mid clover, Come dance in the orchard all under the trees" and "Ring round a rosy, clouds go sailing by, Ring round a rosy, as long as we please." Corrections, red pen.

did.unittitle: Pencil and ink manuscripts, 10 p., late 1930’s, early 1940’s

note.p: Assorted text notes, 1 page of bowing exercises, fragments

did.unittitle: Arrangements, Transcriptions, and Analyses of Other Composer’s Works , circa 1939-1950

scopecontent.p: Manuscripts are assumed to be from Sapp’s time as a student at Harvard, from 1939 to the late 1940’s.

did.unittitle: Arrangements of piano works for orchestra. 15 ink and pencil manuscripts, some corrections in red pen., type="inclusive">undated

scopecontent.p: Sonatina for Piano, Chavez; Five Preludes (Op. 74); Barcarolle no. 3, Fauré; Intermezzo in E major, Brahms; Sonata Op. 53; Variations on a Theme of Paganini; Album Leaf, Scriabin; Le Cahier Romand, Honegger; Prelude and Fugue from Concerto, Stravinsky; Serenade in A, Stravinsky; Fugue from Sonata no. 3, Hindemith; Prelude XI, Debussy; Sonata in C major, Beethoven; Sonata in C minor, Beethoven

did.unittitle: Arrangements of piano works for strings. 3 pencil and ink manuscripts, most works short excerpts, type="inclusive">undated

scopecontent.p: Sonata op. 53; Traumerei, R. Schumann; Sonatina in C Major, Clementi; Serenade, Prelude, Melody, Moment Musicale, March, Fur Elise, Anitra’s Dance, Hungarian Dance, To the Moon, Salut D’amor, La Cinquantine, Funeral March
Nuper Rosarum, Dufay; Missa L’Homme Arme, Palestrina; Messe Notre Dame, Machaut
Quintet Op. 26, Schoenberg

note.p: Title page text: "An analysis according to an original method of the Quintet Op. 26 of Arnold Schoenberg. All the notes of the original Quintet are shown but their function, from a twelve-tone standpoint, is represented by color which denotes the basic form of the tone row and by letter which denotes the position of each note in the statement of the row."

scopecontent.p: Klavierstück Op. 33a, Schoenberg

note.p: Different colors also used for tone-row forms.

scopecontent.p: Atto Secondo (Selection from Act II of Orfeo, Monteverdi)

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog.

otherfindaid.head: Additional Guides
otherfindaid.p: All scores in the collection are cataloged in OCLC and are available in WorldCat and BISON, the online catalog for the University at Buffalo Libraries, by performing a "Title begins with" search under "Allen Sapp Score Collection".

relatedmaterial.head: Related Resources in the Music Library

defitem.label: Allen Sapp Papers Mus. Arc. 11.2
defitem.item: Largely unprocessed collection of documents and correspondence documenting the life of Allen Sapp.
